Issues.Title: Static pipeline column indexers, binary/regression evaluators
Issues.Body:
* Infrastructure for column indexers
* Binary classification and regression evaluators

Fixes #868.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Static pipeline column indexers, binary/regression evaluators" (#869)

Issues.Title: Statically Piped Evaluators for Binary Classification and Regression
Issues.Body:
Now that we have a few trainers/scorers as part of the static pipelines, the next step might be evaluators. This is somewhat different than other components, since evaluators are not pipeline components (excepting per-instance evaluators, perhaps), as we see here in the aspirational examples.

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/df499aa9ea1d671e0df1c432622745c295e3e675/test/Microsoft.ML.Tests/Scenarios/Api/AspirationalExamples.cs#L133

One interesting part of the work is the introduction of a method of identifying columns. We already have this somewhat in the `.Append` method, where we are given an instance of the shape type, and select columns from it to show what to append. Here the technique looks identical, but we're in this case selecting a single item.

What makes me a little nervous about this approach is that if the operations are extension methods on the column types, I see absolutely no way to prevent someone from calling one of those extension methods inside that "indexer" delegate, short of adding more protections in the analyzer. (And, maybe 
this is fine, since the analyzer is clear and really this is probably a mistake a sensible person might plausibly make once.) More generally I talked about this in my remarks on ["context" here](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/632#issuecomment-416391466).

Related to #632.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Statically Piped Evaluators for Binary Classification and Regression" (#868)

Issues.Title: For the GitHub issues classification aspirational example, the 'Area' is not needed as input to Predict(), since it is the label.
Issues.Body: Creating a IssueInput class for the github classification pigsty aspirational example, and removing the Area - since it is the label, ad the ID - since it is not used, from the example. Fixes #841
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "For the GitHub issues classification aspirational example, the 'Area' is not needed as input to Predict(), since it is the label." (#851)

Issues.Title: The "Area" should not be provided as input when predicting a GitHub issue's label/area
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/f89908708f81ae28ad23c7574d405c525ce61b62/test/Microsoft.ML.Tests/Scenarios/Api/AspirationalExamples.cs#L124

I don't think the "area" (such as "area-System.Net") should be provided as input data when predicting the GitHub issue label/area because that is precisely what we want to predict. 

The input data to provide when predicting in this case should just be:
- Issue ID
- Issue name/title
- Issue description
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The "Area" should not be provided as input when predicting a GitHub issue's label/area" (#841)

Issues.Title: Replace DV data type system with .NET standard type system.
Issues.Body:
This change replaces DvType system with .NET standard data type system and fixes #673 

| Old Type | New Type  
|:-:|:-:
| DvInt1 | `sbyte`  
| DvInt2 | `short`  
| DvInt4 | `int`
| DvInt8 | `long`  
| DvBool | `bool`  
| DvDateTime | `DateTime`
| DvDateTimeZone | `DateTimeOffset`  
| DvTimeSpan | `TimeSpan`  
| DvText | `ReadOnlyMemory<char>`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace DV data type system with .NET standard type system." (#863)

Issues.Title: Move IComponentFactory from EntryPoints namespace
Issues.Body:
The current `IComponentFactory` types are in the `Microsoft.ML.Runtime.EntryPoints` namespace.

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/841ba785c58eb84fa0ce07de324f25d6e3dcbf94/src/Microsoft.ML.Core/EntryPoints/ComponentFactory.cs#L7-L12

We should move them to a more appropriate namespace, since `EntryPoint` doesn't really make sense, they are used outside of `EntryPoints`. I think they should go in the same namespace as the `ComponentCatalog`.

Also, we should remove the `IArgsComponent` interface, as I don't see it serving any purpose.

/cc @TomFinley @Zruty0 @codemzs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Move IComponentFactory from EntryPoints namespace" (#861)

Issues.Title: Statically Typed Normalizer Estimators
Issues.Body:
Related to #632, with normalizers being put into the PiGSTy. This is relatively straightforward.

On thing which may not be obvious is the grouping of the mean-var/CDF/log-mean-var/log-CDF normalization functions.

* In the "dynamic" land, mean-var/CDF are grouped, and log-mean-var/log-CDF are grouped.
* In the "static" land, mean-var/log-mean-var, and CDF/log-CDF are grouped.

The former grouping appeared to have been motivated by the fact that the training procedures resembled each other. However in static typed land, what matters more is what the *result* of that training will be, and in mean-var it is always an affine normalizer, and in CDF (whether log-CDF or not) it is a CDF normalizer. For `onFit` to have a sensible signature I must therefore split it up according to that criteria.

Also even though it is not quite efficient now, I feel like exposing the "guts" of things might be aided longterm by shifting what we can to use `ImmutableArray<>`. Not sure though.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Statically Typed Normalizer Estimators" (#843)

Issues.Title: TensorFlowScorer in ML.NET does not support input tensor of unknown shape
Issues.Body:
Using Microsoft.ML 0.5.0
Yael told me she's already working on a PR to fix this issue. 👍 

**Issue/Bug:** 
We’d like to extend your test case TensorFlowTransformCifarLearningPipelineTest for making a demo, but instead of loading your “cifar” frozen model, we’ll be using an inception model trained for imagenet (downloaded from https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/inception5h.zip  ).

The main issue is that when executing the Train method of the pipeline, we get an error related to the initialization of the TensorFlowScorer, which I believe is related with using an input tensor of unknown shape. 

Details of the bug/issue are below, but the main question is if we’ll be able to use an input tensor of unknown shape.
 
var shape = tfShapes[i].ToIntArray().Skip(tfShapes[i][0] == -1 ? BatchSize : 0)

Former code is executed in the method TensorFlowMapper.GetInputMetaData(). tfShapes[i] is an object of type TFShape; if the shape is unknown, accessing by the indexer to the first dimension ( tfSfapes[i][0] ) throws a null exception. I checked that most of the methods in TFShape have a guard condition on dims == null, but the overridden indexer doesn’t have this guard, what could be the culprit of the NullReferenceException

But even if you fix the indexer, then the method tfShapes[i].ToIntArray() it will return null for an unknown tensor, so this will throw again an exception.

Full source code of the demo (and the crash) is available here:
https://github.com/CESARDELATORRE/TensorFlowMLNETSamples/blob/master/src/TensorFlowMLNETInceptionv3ModelScoring/Program.cs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TensorFlowScorer in ML.NET does not support input tensor of unknown shape " (#848)

/cc @TomFinley  @eerhardt
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Proof of concept for debugger visualization" (#847)

Issues.Title: Train operation should be cancellable.
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**: All supported
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: All supported.

### Issue

- I attempt to write training of the models using API as part of internal pipeline
- After I run `pipeline.Train()` I was not able to stop training using standard .NET CancellationToken API
- Please provide ability to cancel such long running operation as training.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Train operation should be cancellable." (#844)

Issues.Title: Modified official build yaml file to also push to VSTS's artifacts tab
Issues.Body:
Fixes #483.

I based my change on [the old version](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/commit/436700aadf615e7f05a22925476cc441c63a919d#diff-fd7f6e99583f511aa0a2af1c74d32620L148) of the file which pushed to the VSTS feed only. In order to keep pushing to MyGet and also push to VSTS I added a new task to the yaml file. The task is identical to what was found in the old version of the file. 

However, I don't know how to test this code and make sure that it works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Modified official build yaml file to also push to VSTS's artifacts tab" (#842)
